definition: to stab/to poke/to prod/to nudge/to disclose
"hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
the Yongjiang river 甬江[Yong3 jiang1] through Ningbo 寧波|宁波[Ning2 bo1]/abbr. for Ningbo
variant of 桶[tong3], bucket/(classifier) cubic dry measure (5 pecks 五斗, approx half-liter)
path screened by walls on both sides
to poke through a hornets' nest/to attack a difficult task resolutely
to make a mess of sth
variant of 捅婁子|捅娄子[tong3 lou2 zi5]
variant of 捅婁子|捅娄子[tong3 lou2 zi5]

sentences.english: Someone stuck a knife into his stomach in a street-fight.
sentences.chinese: 他在街头打斗中被人捅了肚子。

sentences.english: They always negotiate while holding a sword behind their back.
sentences.chinese: 他们总是一边谈判，一边在你背后捅刀子。

sentences.english: “Orange, ” Hattie hissed, nudging me hard in the ribs.
sentences.chinese: “橙色，”海蒂咬牙切齿地说，使劲捅我的肋骨。

sentences.english: They prodded (at) the animal through the bars of its cage.
sentences.chinese: 他们隔着笼子的栏杆用尖东西捅那动物。

sentences.english: I felt as if I had been collectively stabbed in the back by an entire group of my friends.
sentences.chinese: 我感觉到自己是被一群昔日的朋友合伙捅了一刀。

sentences.english: China is such a backstabbing nation anyway.
sentences.chinese: 总之中国是一个背后捅刀子的国家。

sentences.english: First, workers kill each fish by jabbing it in the head with a knife.
sentences.chinese: 首先，工人用刀捅入每条鱼的脑部将它们杀死。

sentences.english: Father poked the fire with a poker.
sentences.chinese: 爸爸用通条把火捅得更旺。

sentences.english: Suddenly, one of them is stabbed by another.
sentences.chinese: 突然，其中一人被另一个用刀捅倒了。

sentences.english: Without a doubt, the thought of being stabbed will affect you more deeply.
sentences.chinese: 无疑被捅了一刀的想象对你印象更深。

sentences.english: The framework of converter puncher is analyzed by fatigue analyzing.
sentences.chinese: 对转炉捅风眼机机架进行疲劳分析。

sentences.english: Prising open the lid on previous mistakes might unleash a political hornet-swarm.
sentences.chinese: 撬开先前的错误或许会捅开一个政治马蜂窝。

sentences.english: He "mechanically" stabbed the mother several times because of this habit.
sentences.chinese: 他“机械地”连捅那位母亲几刀是因为这一习惯。

sentences.english: Lincoln grabs the knife and stabs the guard again.
sentences.chinese: 林肯捡起了刀，再次捅向他。

sentences.english: Emotional, but will not back-stab others.
sentences.chinese: 情绪化，但不会背后捅刀子。

sentences.english: He poked the coals up into a blaze.

definition: to swing (one's arms, a heavy object)/to wave (a sword, one's fists)/to fling (money)
thorn/sting/thrust/to prick/to pierce/to stab/to assassinate/to murder
to hit with a piercing blow
to hack to death/to kill with an ax
to seize/to clutch/to grab firmly and pull
to insert/stick in/pierce/to take part in/to interfere/to interpose
knife/blade/single-edged sword/cutlass/CL:把[ba3]/(slang) dollar (loanword)/classifier for sets of one hundred sheets (of paper)/classifier for knife cuts or stabs
